metadata.title: CVE-2017-5464 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
During DOM manipulations of the accessibility tree through script, the DOMtree can become out of sync with the accessibility tree, leading to memorycorruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affectsThunderbird < 52.1, Firefox ESR < 45.9, Firefox ESR < 52.1, and Firefox <53.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
